marketNews.title: BBCA FY24: Net Profit +12.7% YoY, In Line with Expectations
marketNews.content: Bank Central Asia (BBCA) recorded a net profit of IDR 13.8 trillion in 4Q24 (-3% QoQ, +13% YoY). This result caused the net profit for FY24 to grow to IDR 54.8 trillion (+12.7% YoY), in line with expectations as it equates to 100% of the consensus FY24F estimate. BBCA's positive performance was supported by: 1) Net Interest Margin (NIM) being at the upper end of guidance; 2) Credit Cost (CoC) in line with guidance along with maintained asset quality; and 3) credit growth exceeding guidance. NIM was at the Upper End of Guidance; FY25 NIM Target at 5.7-5.8%. Bank-only NIM in 4Q24 increased to 6%, resulting in an FY24 NIM of 5.8%, situated in the upper range of management's FY24 guidance which had been upgraded to around 5.7-5.8%. BBCA management targets the FY25 NIM to be stable in the range of 5.7-5.8%, the same as the FY24 guidance. CoC In Line with Guidance Along With Maintained Asset Quality; FY25 CoC Target at 0.3%. Bank-only CoC in 4Q24 was recorded at -0.1%, resulting in an FY24 CoC of 0.3%, in line with management's FY24 guidance, which targeted the range of 0.3-0.4%. This result was supported by maintained asset quality, with gross NPL bank-only improving to 1.8% and loan-at-risk (LAR) bank-only falling to 5.3%. BBCA management targets FY25 CoC to remain stable at 0.3%. Credit Growth Exceeded Guidance; Credit Growth to Slow Down in FY25. Credit growth in FY24 stabilized at +13.8% YoY (vs. FY23: +13.9% YoY), exceeding management's FY24 guidance which had been upgraded to the range of +10-12%. Credit growth was driven by the corporate segment at +15.7% YoY, mainly from investment loans. BBCA management targets credit growth to slow down to +6-8% in FY25. Key Takeaway: We assess BBCA's performance in FY24 as positive, with the company's NIM successfully reaching the upper end of guidance and asset quality continuing to improve. The signal of slowing credit growth in FY25 is in line with expectations of weak public purchasing power.

marketNews.title: LINK Confirms Divestment Process from Controller
marketNews.content: Link Net stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company is aware of the share exploration process of LINK from the company's shareholders to access potential investors. However, LINK has not yet received further information from shareholders regarding this matter, nor has any significant or material action been taken. This clarification emerged after DealStreetAsia reported this week that the Axiata group plans to divest its LINK shares with a value reaching US$1 billion or approximately IDR 16 trillion. The Axiata group itself holds 94.64% of LINK shares, consisting of Axiata Investments (Indonesia) Sdn. Bhd. by 75.42% and XL Axiata (EXCL) by 19.22%. As of Thursday (23/1), LINK had a market cap of IDR 6.6 trillion.

marketNews.title: Nikkei Asia reports Bank of Japan set to vote for rate hike to 0.5% on Friday
marketNews.content: Nikkei Asia reported that the Bank of Japan will raise interest rates by +25 bps to 0.5% on Friday (24/1), marking the highest level since October 2008. This move is taken as a normalization process of the central bank's policy along with Japanese inflation reaching 2.9% YoY as of November 2024 - exceeding the Bank of Japan's target of 2% - and domestic wage increases.

marketNews.title: US President, Donald Trump, considering imposing import tariffs on goods from China
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, stated that he is considering imposing import tariffs of 10% on goods from China starting February 1, 2025. This tariff is lower than his campaign promise, which was to impose a 60% import tariff on China. Trump stated that the discourse is based on the fact that China sends fentanyl to Mexico and Canada. Previously, Trump announced during his inauguration a 25% import tariff on Mexico and Canada, based on accusations that both countries allow migrants and illegal drugs to enter the US. Besides China, Trump also mentioned imposing import tariffs on the European Union because the region treats the US very poorly, although he did not elaborate further.

marketNews.title: ESDM Minister Bahlil Lahadalia on Certain Gas Price Incentives (HGBT)
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM), Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Wednesday (22/1) that the price of natural gas in the Certain Natural Gas Price Incentive (HGBT) program will likely increase and will no longer be US$6 per MMBtu. Bahlil estimates that gas used for energy will cost approximately US$7 per MMBtu, while gas used as feedstock will cost around US$6.5 per MMBtu. For context, although the HGBT was previously set at US$6 per MMBtu, the price paid by recipient companies since mid-2023 varied in the range of US$5.39-8.05 per MMBtu. Bahlil also mentioned that the sector recipients of the HGBT incentive will not be expanded, with recipients remaining composed of 7 industrial sectors as in the previous period. Bahlil added that the government plans to set the HGBT incentive for 5 years, instead of 1 year as previously done.

marketNews.title: IDX Announcement on LQ45, IDX30, and IDX80 Index Evaluations Effective February 3 - April 30, 2025
marketNews.content: The IDX on Wednesday (22/1) announced the index evaluation for LQ45, IDX30, and IDX80 with an effective period from February 3 to April 30, 2025. Here are the details: LQ45 - In: CTRA, JPFA, MAPA - Out: BUKA, INTP, MTEL. IDX30 - In: EXCL, ISAT - Out: ACES, PGEO. IDX80 - In: LSIP, SSIA, TAPG - Out: BUKA, MPMX, SMDR.

marketNews.title: KPK to deep dive into Bank Indonesia CSR fund allocations
marketNews.content: The Director of Investigation at KPK, Asep Guntur Rahayu, stated that his team recorded trillions of Rupiah in corporate social responsibility (CSR) funds from Bank Indonesia disbursed to Commission XI of the DPR. Asep also mentioned that they will delve into the admission of a member of Commission XI DPR from the NasDem Party, Satori, who stated that all members of the commission received Bank Indonesia CSR funds channeled through a foundation. Asep confirmed that the KPK investigative team will continue to investigate the misuse of these CSR funds. According to him, there were findings that some of these funds were not used for their intended purpose.

marketNews.title: Bharat Petroleum Corp plans investment to develop Indonesian oil and gas block
marketNews.content: Bharat Petroleum Corp (NSE: BPCL) India announced plans to invest US$121 million to develop the Nunukan gas and oil block in Indonesia. BPCL's exploration unit, Bharat PetroResources, holds a 16.23% stake in the Nunukan block, which is operated by PT Pertamina. The Indian oil refinery company is seeking approval from the Indonesian government for the development of the block.

marketNews.title: DPR agrees to revise Mining Law (UU Minerba)
marketNews.content: The DPR on Thursday (23/1) agreed to launch a formal process to revise the Mining Law (UU Minerba). The revision aims to help the government accelerate the development of the mineral processing industry, as well as regulate mining permits for religious groups and universities. The proposed revision includes plans to grant priority access to mining areas for specific companies for downstreaming purposes. The draft revision will also grant priority access to religious groups and universities for specific metal ore mining areas. The DPR also proposed that mining activities covering less than 2,500 hectares will be prioritized for MSMEs to support the local economy.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia reports broad money supply (M2) growth in December 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that the economy's liquidity or broad money supply (M2) in December 2024 grew by +4.4% YoY to IDR 9,210.8 trillion (vs. November 2024: +6.5% YoY), driven by the growth of narrow money supply (M1) by +5.8% YoY and quasi money by +0.3% YoY.

tickerNews.title: CAMP Controller Sabana Prawirawidjaja Acquires Shares from CEO
tickerNews.content: The controller of Campina Ice Cream Industry, Sabana Prawirawidjaja, purchased approximately 2.4 billion CAMP shares from CAMP President Director, Samudera Prawirawidjaja, at an average price of IDR 230 per share on December 27, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 541.4 billion, with the purpose of the transaction being for business. After this transaction, Sabana's ownership in CAMP increased from 43.94% to 83.94%, while Samudera's ownership decreased from 43.94% to none.

tickerNews.title: PGEO targets 4,930 GWh electricity production in 2025
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy targets electricity production of 4,930 GWh in 2025, up +2.12% YoY from the estimated realization during 2024 at 4,827 GWh. This production increase comes from the start of operation of PLTP Lumut Balai Unit 2, which is targeted to commission in May 2025, bringing PGEO's total installed geothermal power plant capacity up to 728 MW (+8% YoY). Furthermore, PGEO also allocates capex of US$319 million in 2025 (vs. estimated 2024 capex realization: US$180 million).

tickerNews.title: PGAS 2025 Sales Volume Targets and CAPEX Allocation
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara targets natural gas commercial sales volume of approximately 873-958 BBtud in 2025, an increase of about +2-12% YoY compared to the estimated 2024 realization of 852 BBtud. Meanwhile, the targeted gas transmission sales volume in 2025 is 1,435 MMSCFD, down -7% YoY from the estimated 2024 realization of 1,543 MMSCFD. The targeted oil and gas sales volume in 2025 is 17,227 BOEPD, down -16% YoY compared to the estimated 2024 realization of 20,424 BOEPD. Furthermore, the targeted oil transportation volume in 2025 is 178,347 BOEPD, up +11% YoY from the estimated 2024 realization of 161,174 BOEPD. PGAS itself allocates a capex of US$338 million in 2025 (vs. estimated 2024 capex realization: US$258 million).

tickerNews.title: SRTG prepares US$100-150 million investment fund for 2025
tickerNews.content: Saratoga Investama Sedaya's Investment Director, Devin Wirawan, stated that the company allocates an investment fund of around US$100-150 million in 2025, not far different from the 2024 capex realization of US$150 million. Devin mentioned that after the divestment of PT Deltomed Laboratories in mid-2024, they have no plans to sell other portfolios in 2025 because many companies are still under development.

tickerNews.title: HRTA signs IDR 400 billion credit facility from BBRI for capex and working capital
tickerNews.content: Hartadinata Abadi (HRTA) signed a credit facility agreement of up to IDR 400 billion from Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) with a tenor of 3 years and an interest rate of JIBOR 1M + 1.85% per year. This facility is intended for capex financing, working capital, and/or general corporate purposes.

tickerNews.title: SRAJ targets 10-12 hospitals in major cities and reports increased BOR in 2024
tickerNews.content: Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya (SRAJ) informed the IDX that the company targets to have 10-12 hospitals in major cities. Throughout 2024, SRAJ built 1 new hospital in IKN, bringing the total number of hospitals currently owned by the company to 7 units. As of the end of 2024, SRAJ recorded an increase in its bed occupancy rate (BOR) to 57% (vs. 2023: 49%) following an increase in patients from 40,000 to 50,000, even though the number of operating beds increased from 780 units to 860 units.

tickerNews.title: MARK Director Riana purchases 700,000 shares
tickerNews.content: Mark Dynamics Indonesia Director, Riana, purchased 700,000 MARK shares at an average price of IDR 965 per share on January 20, 2025. The total transaction value reached IDR 675.5 million. After this transaction, Riana's ownership in MARK increased from approximately 0% to 0.02%.

tickerNews.title: CMNT signs US$1.05 billion credit facility from Bangkok Bank and BNLI
tickerNews.content: Cemindo Gemilang (CMNT) signed a credit facility agreement of US$1.05 billion from Bangkok Bank Public Company Limited and Bank Permata (BNLI). The loan consists of: 1) tranche A worth US$420 million with a term of 84 months and extendable for 24 months; 2) tranche B worth US$30 million with a term of 72 months; 3) working capital revolving facility worth US$53 million; and 4) hedging facility worth US$550 million with a term of 12 months. CMNT explained that this credit facility does not increase the company's debt and is a consolidation step for various loan facilities previously owned by the company into 1 facility with a better financing structure.

tickerNews.title: HILL plans a 1:5 stock split, subject to GMSLB approval
tickerNews.content: Hillcon plans to conduct a stock split with a ratio of 1:5, with the first trading of shares with a new nominal value in the regular and negotiation markets on March 10, 2025. This plan will be discussed in the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on March 3, 2025.

tickerNews.title: BBLD signs IDR 250 billion credit facility from BVIC for consumer finance lending
tickerNews.content: Buana Finance (BBLD) signed a credit facility worth IDR 250 billion from Bank Victoria International (BVIC) with a tenor of up to 48 months. This facility is intended for providing consumer finance credit.

tickerNews.title: UANG plans IDR 218 billion capital injection to subsidiary for real estate development
tickerNews.content: Pakuan (UANG) announced plans for a capital increase of IDR 218 billion to its subsidiary, PT Vasamty Land Sawangan, through the placement of new shares. This transaction is intended for the development of the business activities of PT Vasamty Land Sawangan, which operates in the real estate sector, where the company plans to commence construction in 2025 and begin commercial operations and recognize revenue in 2026. This plan will be discussed in an independent General Meeting of Shareholders on February 28, 2025.
